meanings.definition: The act of relegating someone or something to a lower rank or position.
meanings.sent1: After his mistakes, his relegation to a lower job role was inevitable.
meanings.sent2: Her relegation to the bench disappointed her, but she accepted it gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The cat's relegation to the floor from the cozy couch caused a meow of protest.
meanings.sent4: The relegation of the old building to a storage shed was a sad sight.
meanings.sent5: The relegation of the once-proud ship to a mere ferry was a humbling experience.

meanings.definition: The state of being relegated to a lower rank or position.
meanings.sent1: The team's relegation in the league standings was a blow to their morale.
meanings.sent2: His relegation to a lower class made him work harder to improve.
meanings.sent3: The cake's relegation to the back of the fridge led to its forgotten fate.
meanings.sent4: The relegation of the sun behind the clouds signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The relegation of the book to the bottom shelf made it hard to find.
